subject: Photography
title: Triadic Color Harmony
description: A short lesson to help you apply Triadic Color Harmony.

hook.text: Red, yellow, and blue. Three colors spaced equally around the wheel create bold, balanced energy.

buildup.text: A triadic scheme uses three colors evenly spaced at 120-degree intervals on the color wheel.

discovery.text: Triadic palettes feel vibrant and dynamic. They're common in graphic design but rarer in natural photography.

twist.text: Using three bold colors equally creates chaos. The trick: one dominant, one supporting, one accent.

climax.text: Street markets, festivals, and urban murals naturally display triadic colors â€” making them photographic gold.

punchline.text: Three colors, equally spaced, perfectly balanced.

quiz.question: How should triadic colors be balanced in a photograph?
options: One dominant, one supporting, and one accent color
